alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Pima; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:17PM MST until August 21 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... Southeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... Northeastern Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 815 PM MST. * At 617 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, mainly between Whetstone and Tombstone. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Benson, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Elgin, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca and Fairbank. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
